"They" *do* accept patches, especially clean code that comes with unit
tests.

(for example, see
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=402961&group_id=152
78&atid=315278)

Maybe they are more conservative then say, JUnitX, or other projects but I
think that is ok; their goal _seem_ to be more a simple and clean package
than a feature packed one. That's the open-source way: everybody is able to
pick what he needs.

mathieu

----- Original Message -----
From: Brekke, Jeff
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Sent: Thursday, June 21, 2001 8:42 AM
Subject: RE: [junit] How do I submit code which I think should be added to
JUnit?


What's the point of having the code in sourceforge if they don't except
patches?  Are most users using JUnitX because of this?  I a little
confused...

-----------------------------------------------------------------
    Throw away my code, but never, never throw away my tests.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Jeffrey D. Brekke                                   Quad/Graphics
Jeff.Brekke@...                              http://www.qg.com
-----------------------------------------------------------------
